events.originalText: The second phase of the Thomson-East Coast MRT line opens for service
events.subtitle: Thomson–East Coast MRT line
events.headline: Thomson-East Coast MRT line Phase 2 opens for service

events.originalText: A pizza delivery man in Erie, Pennsylvania, was killed during a complex bank robbery when a bomb that was locked around his neck exploded.
events.subtitle: Erie, Pennsylvania
events.headline: Pizza delivery man killed in Erie bank robbery

events.originalText: The NASA spacecraft Galileo flew by the asteroid 243 Ida and took photographs that later revealed the first known asteroid moon (both pictured).
events.subtitle: Galileo (spacecraft)
events.headline: NASA spacecraft Galileo discovers asteroid moon

events.originalText: The first direct Presidential election in Singapore was held.
events.subtitle: 1993 Singaporean presidential election
events.headline: Singapore holds first direct Presidential election

events.originalText: Construction began on the Ryugyong Hotel (pictured) in Pyongyang, the tallest building in North Korea.
events.subtitle: Ryugyong Hotel
events.headline: Construction begins on Ryugyong Hotel in Pyongyang

events.originalText: Swedish police used gas bombs to end a seven-day hostage situation in Stockholm; during the incident the hostages had bonded with their captors, leading to the term Stockholm syndrome.
events.subtitle: Norrmalmstorg robbery
events.headline: Swedish police end Stockholm hostage situation with gas bombs

events.originalText: American civil-rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. delivered the speech "I Have a Dream" during the March on Washington, calling for civil and economic rights and an end to racism in the United States.
events.subtitle: Martin Luther King Jr.
events.headline: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers 'I Have a Dream' speech

events.originalText: African-American teenager Emmett Till was lynched near Money, Mississippi, for allegedly flirting with a white woman, energizing the nascent American civil rights movement.
events.subtitle: Emmett Till
events.headline: Emmett Till lynched in Mississippi for alleged flirting

events.originalText: In tennis, Althea Gibson became the first African-American woman to compete at the U.S. National Championships.
events.subtitle: Althea Gibson
events.headline: Althea Gibson first African-American woman at U.S. National Championships

events.originalText: In the first naval battle of the First World War, British ships ambushed a German naval patrol in the Heligoland Bight.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British ships ambush German naval patrol in First World War battle

events.originalText: The 1909 Monterrey hurricane dissipated; one of the deadliest Atlantic tropical cyclones on record, it killed an estimated 4,000 people throughout Mexico.
events.subtitle: 1909 Monterrey hurricane
events.headline: 1909 Monterrey hurricane kills 4,000 in Mexico

events.originalText: The Slavery Abolition Act 1833, officially abolishing slavery in most of the British Empire, received royal assent.
events.subtitle: Slavery Abolition Act 1833
events.headline: Slavery Abolition Act 1833 abolishes slavery in British Empire

events.originalText: Tom Thumb, the first American-built steam locomotive, engaged in an impromptu race against a horse-drawn car in Maryland.
events.subtitle: Tom Thumb (locomotive)
events.headline: Tom Thumb steam locomotive races horse-drawn car in Maryland

events.originalText: With the first use of his new 1.2-metre (3.9 ft) telescope, then the largest in the world, William Herschel discovered a new moon of Saturn, later named Enceladus.
events.subtitle: William Herschel
events.headline: William Herschel discovers new moon of Saturn with telescope

events.originalText: William Herschel discovered Enceladus, a moon of Saturn, during the first use of his new telescope which was then the largest in the world.
events.subtitle: William Herschel
events.headline: William Herschel discovers moon of Saturn with new telescope

events.originalText: Bishops' Wars: Scottish Covenanter forces led by Alexander Leslie defeated the English army near Newburn, England.
events.subtitle: Bishops' Wars
events.headline: Scottish forces defeat English army near Newburn

events.originalText: Ferdinand II, King of Bohemia and Hungary, was unanimously elected Holy Roman Emperor.
events.subtitle: Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor
events.headline: Ferdinand II elected Holy Roman Emperor

events.originalText: Ottoman–Portuguese conflicts: During the Battle of Wofla, the Portuguese commander Cristóvão da Gama was captured by the Adal Sultanate and executed the next day.
events.subtitle: Ottoman–Portuguese conflicts (1538–1560)
events.headline: Portuguese commander captured and executed during Battle of Wofla

events.originalText: Orestes took control of Ravenna, the capital of the Western Roman Empire, forcing Emperor Julius Nepos to flee.
events.subtitle: Orestes (father of Romulus Augustulus)
events.headline: Orestes takes control of Ravenna, forcing Emperor Julius Nepos to flee
